books.title: Design by Numbers
books.author: John Maeda
books.reference: Maeda, John. Design by Numbers. MIT Press, 1999.
books.description: A foundational text exploring the intersection of programming and visual design, introducing computational thinking to artists and designers through simple coding exercises.

books.title: Processing: A Programming Handbook for Visual Designers and Artists
books.author: Casey Reas and Ben Fry
books.reference: Reas, Casey, and Ben Fry. Processing: A Programming Handbook for Visual Designers and Artists. 2nd ed., MIT Press, 2014.
books.description: A comprehensive guide to the Processing programming language, designed to teach visual artists and designers how to create interactive graphics, animations, and computational art.

books.title: The Design of Everyday Things
books.author: Donald A. Norman
books.reference: Norman, Donald A. The Design of Everyday Things: Revised and Expanded Edition. Basic Books, 2013.
books.description: A classic text on human-centered design principles, exploring how good design makes products intuitive and how poor design leads to frustration and errors.
